title: Quiz - Economic History of India - Part 2

quiz.text: What was the duration of Second Five Year Plan?
options: 1957-62
1958-63
1955-60
1956-61
1961-66

quiz.text: In which Five Year Plan the objective of growth with stability and progressive achievement of self reliance was set?
options: Third Five Year Plan
Fourth Five Year Plan
Fifth Five Year Plan
Sixth Five Year Plan
Seventh Five Year Plan

quiz.text: What was on top priority in the First Five Year Plan in India
options: Agriculture
Steel Plants
Ports
Industries
Services

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements:
  1. This plan focused on Inclusive growth 
  2. India had emerged as one of the fastest-growing economies by the end of its previous plan
  3. The broad vision of this plan included several interrelated components like rapid growth reducing poverty & creating employment opportunities using the National Rural Employment Guarantee Programme, environmental sustainability, and reduction of gender inequality.
Which of the following Five Year Plan is discussed in the above statements?
options: Ninth
tenth
Eleventh
Eighth
Seventh

quiz.text: Which Five Year Plan had the primary goal to establish India as a self-reliant and self-generating economy?
options: First Five Year Plan
Second Five Year Plan
Third Five Year Plan
Fourth Five Year Plan
None of the above

quiz.text: Under which Five Year Plan was the decision to establish a socialistic pattern of society taken?
options: First
Second
Third
Fourth
Fifth

quiz.text: During which Five Year Plan 14 major Indian banks were nationalised and the Green Revolution was started?
options: Third
Fourth
Fifth
Sixth
Seventh

quiz.text: Which of the following person drafted the Second Five Year Plan?
options: N.V Gadgil
V.K.R.V Rao
P.C Mahalanobis
C.N Lawyer
None of the above

quiz.text: Which one of the following Five-Year Plans recognised human developments as the core of all development efforts?
options: Second Five Year Plan
Third Five Year Plan
Fourth Five Year Plan
Eighth Five Year Plan
Sixth Five Year Plan

quiz.text: Consider the following statements -  1) During this plan Jawahar Rojgar Yojana was launched 2) This plan also encouraged 'Social Justice' 3) It also laid impetus on the development of small-scale and food processing industries Which Five Year plan is discussed in the above statements?
options: Sixth Five Year Plan
Eighth Five Year Plan
Ninth Five Year Plan
Seventh Five Year Plan
Tenth Five Year Plan

quiz.text: The basic objective of Fifth Five Year Plan was
options: Poverty Removal
Reforms in PDS
Inclusive Growth
Agricultural Development
Growth in Service Sector

quiz.text: In India which of the following Five Year Plans was launched with a focus on sustainable growth?
options: Ninth Five Year Plan
Tenth Five Year Plan
Eleventh Five Year Plan
Twelfth Five Year Plan
Eighth Five Year Plan

quiz.text: Under which Five Year Plan 'Blue Revolution' was started in India?
options: Sixth
Seventh
Eighth
Fifth
Fourth

quiz.text: Which one of the following is not a feature of the Nehru-Mahalanobis model of development strategy?
options: Development of capital goods and industries
Major involvement of the States in the economy
Industrial deregulation and disinvestment in the public sector
Enhancing the scope and importance of the public sector
None of the above

quiz.text: During which Five Year Plan India opt for a mixed economy?
options: First Five Year Plan
Second Five Year Plan
Third Five Year Plan
Fourth Five Year Plan
Fifth Five Year Plan

quiz.text: The Annual Plan described as 'Plan Holiday' were implemented during
options: 1965-66
1966-69
1967-70
1968-71
1971-74

quiz.text:
With reference to India's Five-year Plans, which of the following statements is/are correct?
  1. From the Second Five-Year Plan, there was a determined thrust towards substitution of basic and capital good industries.
  2. The Fourth Five Year Plan adopted the objective of correcting the earlier trend of increased concentration of wealth and economic power.
  3. In the Fifth Five-Year Plan, for the first time, the financial sector was included as an integral part of the plan.
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
options: 1 and 2 only
2 only
3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 and 3 only

quiz.text: Who wrote the book ''Planned Economy for India''?
options: Sardar Patel
M Visvesvaraya
Jawahar Lal Nehru
Mahatma Gandhi
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a part of new economic reforms?
options: Liberalisation
Globalisation
Privatisation
Decentralization
None of the above

quiz.text: First generation of reforms were implemented between which of the following years in India?
options: 1990-1995
1991-1996
1991-2000
1992-1997
1995-2000

quiz.text: Second generation of reforms were implemented from which of the following year onwards in India?
options: 1991 onwards
2005 onwards
2000-01 onwards
2010 onwards
2007 Onwards

quiz.text: Second-generation reforms in our country do not comprise of which one of the following?
options: Exploiting the knowledge-based global economy
Growing MNCs in India
Population control
Clean environment
Both A and B

quiz.text:
Which of the following are parts of the structural Adjustment Programs of New Economic Policy in 1991?
  1. Industrial reforms
  2. Balance of Payment Adjustment
  3. Tax reforms
  4. Fiscal reforms
options: 1 only
2 and 4 only
1, 2 and 3 only
1, 3 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: APM is the term used in the second-generation reforms. What is the fullform of APM?
options: Administrator and Person's Mentor
Administrator's and People's Mechanism
Administered Price Mechanism
Administered People Mechanism
None of the above

quiz.text:
What were the main reasons behind the Economic reforms of 1991?
  1. Huge external debt and rise in Fiscal Deficit
  2. Rising prices of essential goods
  3. Balance of Payment crisis
  4. Iraq war
options: 1, 2 and 3
2, 3 and 4
1, 3 and 4
1 and 3 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text:
The economic crisis of 1991 was characterized by
  1. Reduced Foreign Exchange Reserves
  2. Rolling over of Indian foreign debt by internal creditors
  3. Increase in the fiscal deficit
  4. Sale of gold from reserves
Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1, 2 and 3 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: Which of the following has/have occurred in India after its liberalization of economic policies in 1991? 1) Share of agriculture in GDP increased enormously  2) Share of India's exports in world trade increased 3) FDI Inflows increased  4) India's foreign exchange reserves increased enormously
options: 1 and 4 only
2, 3 and 4 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2, 3 and 4
1 and 3 only

quiz.text: Which committee was formulated to look into the matter of capital account convertibility in India?
options: Narasimham Committee
Tarapore Committee
Tendon Committee
Chore Committee
None of the above

quiz.text: To solve the Balance of Payment crisis of 1991, the Indian Rupee was_________ against foreign currencies
options: Appreciated
Depreciated
Revalued
Devalued
Both A and C

quiz.text: 'License - Permit - Quota Raj' was abolished in which year?
options: 1991
1948
1956
1977
1985

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the concept of Economic reform:
  1. Economic reforms denote the process in which a government prescribes a declining role for the state and expanding role for the private sector in an economy.
  2. It is safer to see economic reform as a policy shift in an economy from one to another or alternative development strategies.
  3. India carried out economic reforms in 2001.
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
options: Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3
Only 2 and 3
1,2 and 3
Only 1

quiz.text: The foreign exchange market, Stock exchange market, banking and non banking financial institutions are a part of ___________.
options: Fiscal sector reforms
Financial sector reforms
Industrial sector reforms
Public sector reforms
None of the above

quiz.text: What was the total amount of the loans provided by the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank during the nineties to help India during its financial crisis?
options: 13 billion US dollars
15 billion US dollars
5 billion US dollars
7 billion US dollars
3 billion US dollars

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the concept of the term Globalisation:
  1. Globalisation is generally termed as an increase in economic integration among nations.
  2. Globalisation lasted from 1800 to almost 1930, interrupted by the Great Depression and the two Wars which led to retrenchment, and several trade barriers were erected since the early 1930s.
  3. The concept was popularised by the Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) in the mid-1980s again after the Wars.
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
options: Only 1
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 Only
1 and 3 Only
All of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the term, liberalization which show the direction of reform undertaken by the Indian Economy:
  1. The term liberalization has its origin in the political ideology liberalism which took its form in the early nineteenth century.
  2. The term liberalization is sometimes portrayed as a meta-ideology capable of embracing a broad range of rival values and beliefs.
  3. The meta-ideology ideology was the product of the breakdown of feudalism and the growth of a market or capitalist society in its place which became popular in economics via the writings of Adam Smith.
Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct?
options: Only 1
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
All of the above
1 and 3 only
